reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Finnpartnership: Opportunities for offering education services in India

description.narrative: The project aims to establish opportunities and basis for offering education services in India. More specifically in order to develop professional education in the target country the objective is to start cooperation between Lahti University of Applied Sci ences (Lahti UAS) and companies operating in the fields of education health services and technology.The project focuses on identifying education and business development needs in India and meeting the identified needs through Finnish education know-how in the following two areas: social and health care and business. Moreover the project identifies cooperation partners in India and creates a cooperation strategy together with the Indian partners. The project also identifies the legal and economic requirement s affecting such cooperation. Related to this the project creates an action plan for offering education services and aims to make and sign education services contracts (minimum 3).The project produces descriptions for education modules aimed at developing professional competence in the target country. The project also establishes a cooperation network and operations model with other Finnish organizations (The University of Helsinki Lappeenranta University of Technology Jyväskylä University of Applied Scie nces). During the project the participants will organize two events to demonstrate Finnish education and development know-how to the Indian partners.Underlying the project is Lahti UAS?s strategic objective to identify business opportunities in India and t o start offering education services in areas that need development cooperation (e.g. health care services). Lahti UAS has gained valuable experience in offering education services in Kazakhstan since 2012. The project can benefit from this experience when establishing cooperation with the identified Indian partners. In addition underlying the project is Lahti UAS?s cooperation with Medipoc Oy which has an ongoing partnership with an Indian-based company Sahamanthran Pvt Ltd.
